thread.title: Prep Roundup: Briggs scores three times for ACS; W. Alamance runners win
thread.title_full: Prep Roundup: Briggs scores three times for ACS; W. Alamance runners win

author: Times-News
title: Prep Roundup: Briggs scores three times for ACS; W. Alamance runners win
text: Posted Oct. 7, 2015 at 12:18 AM Updated Oct 7, 2015 at 1:12 AM By Times-News Posted Oct. 7, 2015 at 12:18 AM Updated Oct 7, 2015 at 1:12 AM GRAHAM — Alex Briggs scored three second-half goals to lead Alamance Christian School to a 4-1 victory against Gospel Light in boys’ soccer Tuesday night. The Warriors (11-2-1 overall, 7-1 North Carolina Christian School Association) trailed 1-0 at halftime. Caleb LaTour’s goal tied the game just minutes into the second half. LaTour also recorded an assist. ACS outshot the visitors 19-6, and Sam Fernandez’s defensive pressure kept Gospel Light’s shots to a minimum. Marco Roman recorded 11 saves in goal for Gospel Light (9-5-0, 7-1). ■ BURLINGTON CHRISTIAN ACADEMY 6, THE BURLINGTON SCHOOL 3: Jacob Hartley recorded a hat trick to lead the Royals to a Triad Athletic Conference victory. Adam Hartley, Britton Batts and Jack Mundy also scored for BCA (5-8, 3-5). The BurlingtonSchool and BCA each had 12 shots. BCA goalkeeper Matthew Wright recorded nine saves. ■ SOUTHERN ALAMANCE 2, SOUTHEAST GUILFORD 0: At Mt. Hermon, Zach Cates scored a first-half goal and Daniel Pineda scored in the second half to lead the Patriots to an All Metro Conference victory. Southern Alamance (6-4-1, 1-0-0) outshot the Falcons 16-8. Chris Giacobello recorded all eight saves for the Patriots. Volleyball At Wentworth, Western Alamance claimed a five-set Mid-State 3-A Conference victory against host Rockingham County. The Warriors won 25-19, 22-25, 25-17, 19-25, 15-13. Sarah Pittard tallied 16 kills and seven aces to lead Western Alamance (10-7, 7-6). Jessica Walker finished with 11 kills and five blocks, while Kyler Johnson had 12 digs. Rockingham County fell to 10-9, 5-9. ■ SOUTHERN ALAMANCE 3: SOUTHEAST GUILFORD 0: At Mt. Hermon, Southern Alamance swept visiting Southeast Guilford 25-21, 25-19, 25-22. Taylor Haney paced the Patriots with 12 kills and five aces. Taylor Hendrix added 19 assists and seven digs, while Jenna Haugle had eight assists and five digs. Brooke Barham and Nicole Byrd both had eight kills for Southern Alamance (10-10, 4-3). Skylar Doss finished with eight digs, Anna Allred had six digs and Allison Allred served three aces. ■ GRAHAM 3, JORDAN-MATTHEWS 0: At Siler City, the visiting Red Devils captured a Mid-State 2-A Conference match, winning 25-14, 25-23, 25-13. Sydney McCann powered eight kills, 11 digs and six assists, while Alexia Matias had 15 assists and three digs for Graham (5-9, 5-2). Izlyn Law recorded 16 digs and had two assists. Sequoia Evans tallied 12 assists and three digs, while Rebecca Henry had six digs. ■ WILLIAMS 3, NORTHEAST GUILFORD 0: At McLeansville, the Bulldogs earned a 25-18, 25-19, 25-17Mid-State 3-A Conference victory. The Bulldogs (8-10, 4-8) were led by Bella Huerta’s 19 assists, four kills, three digs and six aces. Dinaisya Harrison smashed 10 kills and recorded seven digs, while Kenzie Vance tallied 12 digs, two kills and two aces. Mekayla White had eight kills and five digs. Rebecca Hunnicutt finished with six kills and two aces. Page 2 of 2 - Cross country At Elon, host Western Alamance won the boys’ and the girls’ tri-meet against McMichael and Northeast Guilford. In the boys’ race, the Warriors finished with 20 points, followed by McMichael (37), and then Northeast Guilford (89). Hunter Gilbert of Western Alamance won medalist honors, running the 3.1-mile course in 16 minutes, 11 seconds. Four other Warriors finished in the top 10. Gilbert was followed by Jacob DeAngelo (16:41). The Western Alamance girls’ team had seven runners place in the top 10. Jules Marlow won the race at 23:09, while Silken Carlton finished second with 23:37. The Warriors finished with 18 points. McMichael had 45 points and Northeast Guilford didn’t have a team score. ■ At Greensboro, Northern Guilford dominated both the boys’ and girls’ races in a tri-meet with Williams and Eden Morehead. The Nighthawks won the boys’ race with 16 points, followed by Williams (51) and Eden Morehead (75). Northern Guilford held nine of the top 10 positions. Williams’ Harrison Stuart finished fifth in 19:23.35. For girls, the Bulldogs’ Anders Robinson placed third in 22:22.59. Northern Guilford finished with 18 points and took eight of the top 10 positions. Williams finished with 45 points and Eden Morehead had no team score. By Times-News
